meanings.definition: Of a pale gray color, as in the color of ashes.
meanings.sent1: Her face turned ashen when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent2: The sky was ashen with heavy clouds before the storm.
meanings.sent3: The ashen walls of the old house made it look haunted.
meanings.sent4: His ashen expression revealed his fear of the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The ashen moon cast a ghostly light over the deserted street.

meanings.sent1: The pot was covered in an ashen layer after the fire.
meanings.sent2: The ashen statue crumbled to dust with age.
meanings.sent3: The ashen cake tasted surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her ashen hair shimmered like silver in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ashen clouds resembled a blanket of sorrow in the sky.

meanings.definition: Lacking vitality or color; pale and dull.
meanings.sent1: His ashen complexion indicated his illness.
meanings.sent2: The ashen flowers wilted in the scorching heat.
meanings.sent3: The ashen sky made the landscape seem lifeless.
meanings.sent4: Her ashen voice lacked its usual enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The ashen landscape was devoid of any signs of life.
